page.title: 08SOCIAL SURVEY (2)
page.content: LIFESTYLES. Approximately 75% of the sample were car owners. Only one household in five had no independent means of transport, although the area is well served by several bus routes. Over half of those interviewed took all of their holidays in Britain, whilst one in eight only holidayed abroad. However, about one third enjoyed both types of holiday. One in five said that they never took an extended holiday away from home. In an age of electronics, only one person did not possess a television receiver. Most families had both radio and television sets, record-player, a washing machine(but only half had electric driers), refrigerator and freezer. A third of the sample now owned, or rented, a video recorder, and an increasing number of households(25%) owned a home computer.
